message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.PE, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on increasing spectral efficiency in TCP/IP transmissions, which is a key aspect of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the design of a bit-to-time-slot mapping table, which involves information theory concepts such as channel coding and modulation. 
3. cs.COMM (Communication) - The paper proposes a new communication scheme that involves dividing a bit-unit into opportunistic and conventional bits, which is a communication-related concept. 
4. cs.PE (Performance) - The paper aims to improve the performance of TCP/IP transmissions by increasing spectral efficiency, which falls under the performance category. 
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper involves designing a system for mapping bits to time slots, which could fall under the systems and control category.
